31128.modal:
×

Hoppin' John

Ingredients needed: 1 10- ounces package frozen black-eyed peas, 1/8 teaspoon cayenne, 3 cups canned low-sodium chicken broth or homemade stock, 1/2 pound collard greens, tough stems removed, leaves washed well and shredded, 1/2 pound kielbasa or other smoked sausage, halved lengthwise then cut crosswise into 1-inch slices, 1 onion, chopped, 1 1/2 cups long-grain rice, 4 scallions, white bulbs sliced and green tops cut into 1/2-inch pieces,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free,
  • 1: Bring all ingredients except rice to boil in Dutch oven, stirring occasionally.
  • 2: Stir in rice; cover. Simmer 10 min. or until tender.
  • 1: Bring all ingredients except rice to boil in Dutch oven, stirring occasionally.
  • 2: Stir in rice; cover. Simmer 10 min. or until tender.
  • 1: (Soak black-eyed peas in cool water for at least 6 hours. Rinse before using.)
  • 2: Heat butter in a large pot over medium-high heat.
  • 3: Add onion, garlic, green pepper, and celery and stir. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in soaked beans, then add chicken broth, ham hock, salt & pepper, and cayenne to taste. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cover the pot for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, check the liquid level; if it's too soupy, cook with the lid off for another 15 minutes or so. If it's too thick, splash in a little more broth. Stir in vinegar, then taste for seasonings.
  • 4: Add more spice if needed.
  • 5: Serve over white or brown rice, making sure to get plenty of the cooking liquid spooned over the top. Or, you may mix the bean mixture with the rice before serving. Variations: add red bell pepper, canned diced tomatoes, diced jalapenos, diced ham (instead of ham hocks), or sliced bacon (instead of ham hocks). Stir in torn-up kale when 5 minutes of cooking time remain. Variation: use canned, drained black-eyed peas if preferred. Just use diced ham instead of ham hock and a little less broth, as peas won't need to cook as long.
  • 1: (Soak black-eyed peas in cool water for at least 6 hours. Rinse before using.)
  • 2: Heat butter in a large pot over medium-high heat.
  • 3: Add onion, garlic, green pepper, and celery and stir. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in soaked beans, then add chicken broth, ham hock, salt & pepper, and cayenne to taste. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cover the pot for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, check the liquid level; if it's too soupy, cook with the lid off for another 15 minutes or so. If it's too thick, splash in a little more broth. Stir in vinegar, then taste for seasonings.
  • 4: Add more spice if needed.
  • 5: Serve over white or brown rice, making sure to get plenty of the cooking liquid spooned over the top. Or, you may mix the bean mixture with the rice before serving. Variations: add red bell pepper, canned diced tomatoes, diced jalapenos, diced ham (instead of ham hocks), or sliced bacon (instead of ham hocks). Stir in torn-up kale when 5 minutes of cooking time remain. Variation: use canned, drained black-eyed peas if preferred. Just use diced ham instead of ham hock and a little less broth, as peas won't need to cook as long.
  • 1: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the oil over moderately low heat.
  • 2: Add the onion and the scallion bulbs and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
  • 3: Add the collard greens, salt, black pepper, and cayenne and cook, stirring, until the greens wilt, about 1 minute.
  • 4: Increase the heat to moderately high.
  • 5: Add the sausage, black-eyed peas, and rice and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Stir in the broth and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and cook, covered, until the rice is tender and all the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
  • 6: Remove from the heat and stir in the scallion tops.
  • 7: Wine Recommendation: The robust flavors of Hoppin' John call for an equally assertive wine. Go for a brash, full-bodied red zinfandel from California. Its spicy blackberry richness is easily up to the task.
  • 8: Notes: Collard greens braised to melting softness in the Southern style (slow-simmered with plenty of pork) are truly delicious, but the greens don't actually have to cook for hours. In twenty minutes they'll be just tender.
  • 1: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the oil over moderately low heat.
  • 2: Add the onion and the scallion bulbs and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
  • 3: Add the collard greens, salt, black pepper, and cayenne and cook, stirring, until the greens wilt, about 1 minute.
  • 4: Increase the heat to moderately high.
  • 5: Add the sausage, black-eyed peas, and rice and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Stir in the broth and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and cook, covered, until the rice is tender and all the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
  • 6: Remove from the heat and stir in the scallion tops.
  • 7: Wine Recommendation: The robust flavors of Hoppin' John call for an equally assertive wine. Go for a brash, full-bodied red zinfandel from California. Its spicy blackberry richness is easily up to the task.
  • 8: Notes: Collard greens braised to melting softness in the Southern style (slow-simmered with plenty of pork) are truly delicious, but the greens don't actually have to cook for hours. In twenty minutes they'll be just tender.

Paella

Ingredients needed: 25 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs, 2 1/2 pounds calamari, cleaned and cut crosswise into 1/2-inch rings, 8 cups homemade or store-bought chicken stock, 3/4 cup cognac, 4 cups fresh or frozen peas, 1/4 cup finely chopped garlic, 3 green bell peppers, cut into quarters, stemmed, seeded, and ribs removed, 1 1/4 pounds haricots verts, trimmed and cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces, 25 jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined, 2 pounds pork tenderloin, trimmed and cut into 1-inch cubes, 1/2 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice, 2 (10-ounce) packages frozen lima beans, 2 1/2 dozen littleneck clams, scrubbed, 3 dozen mussels, scrubbed, 2 onions, chopped, 1 1/2 tablespoons paprika, 3 red bell peppers, cut into quarters, stemmed, seeded, and ribs removed, 2 tablespoons saffron, 8 large tomatoes, 3 pounds white rice,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free,
  • 1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil; meanwhile, prepare an ice-water bath. With a paring knife, core tomatoes, and score an X on the bottoms. Working in batches, carefully lower tomatoes into boiling water; when skins begin to split, after 30 to 60 seconds, use a slotted spoon to transfer tomatoes to water bath.
  • 1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil; meanwhile, prepare an ice-water bath. With a paring knife, core tomatoes, and score an X on the bottoms. Working in batches, carefully lower tomatoes into boiling water; when skins begin to split, after 30 to 60 seconds, use a slotted spoon to transfer tomatoes to water bath.
  • 1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil; meanwhile, prepare an ice-water bath. With a paring knife, core tomatoes, and score an X on the bottoms. Working in batches, carefully lower tomatoes into boiling water; when skins begin to split, after 30 to 60 seconds, use a slotted spoon to transfer tomatoes to water bath.

Caribbean Rice

Ingredients needed: 1 3/4 cups (1/4-inch) cubed peeled butternut squash, 1 (15-ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained, 1 1/4 cups fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth, 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric, 1 cup light coconut milk, 1 cup chopped onion, 1 cup long-grain parboiled rice (such as Uncle Ben's),
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian,
  • 1: Bring broth and coconut milk to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat; add rice. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.
  • 2: Remove from heat; keep warm.
  • 3: Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
  • 4: Add onion; saut 5 minutes.
  • 5: Reduce heat to medium.
  • 6: Add squash; cook 8 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in thyme and remaining ingredients; cook 3 minutes or until thoroughly heated, stirring occasionally.
  • 7: Add rice to squash mixture, stirring to combine.
  • 1: Bring broth and coconut milk to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat; add rice. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.
  • 2: Remove from heat; keep warm.
  • 3: Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
  • 4: Add onion; saut 5 minutes.
  • 5: Reduce heat to medium.
  • 6: Add squash; cook 8 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in thyme and remaining ingredients; cook 3 minutes or until thoroughly heated, stirring occasionally.
  • 7: Add rice to squash mixture, stirring to combine.

  • 7: Add rice to squash mixture, stirring to combine.

212292.modal:
×

Hot smoked salmon & dill spaghetti

Ingredients needed: 150-160g pack hot smoked salmon, 400g good-quality dried spaghetti, a small bunch fresh dill (a supermarket packet is about right), 3 tbsp (rounded) crème fraîche,
Diets supported: pescatarian,
  • 1: First prepare the salmon. Flake the salmon into mouthful-sized chunks in a bowl. Bring a large pan of generously salted water to the boil.
  • 2: Cook the pasta. Feed the spaghetti into the pan, give it a stir, then cook at a rolling boil, stirring occasionally to keep the strands separate, until the pasta is just tender but with a bite. Check the cooking time on the pack, as it does vary. When the pasta is almost done, throw in the peas.
  • 3: Finish the dish: remove any tough stalks from the dill, then chop the fronds fairly roughly. Reserve about 4 tablespoons of the pasta water, then drain the pasta and peas and return them to the pan with the reserved water. Set over a very low heat, then toss in the salmon, dill, crme frache, salt and plenty of freshly ground black pepper. Toss everything together lightly and heat through briefly, then serve.

Salmon, fennel & lime plates

Ingredients needed: 140g smoked salmon, 1 fennel, finely sliced, 1 red onion, finely sliced, juice 1 lime, 2 tsp white wine vinegar,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free, paleolithic, primal, whole 30, pescatarian,
  • 1: Divide the smoked salmon between 4 plates. Toss the fennel, red onion, lime juice, white wine vinegar, olive oil and a little black pepper. Arrange over the salmon and serve.

Fiesta Chowder

Ingredients needed: 1 (15-ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained, 1 (4.5-ounce) can chopped green chiles, 1 (14 1/2-ounce) can Mexican-style stewed tomatoes, 1 (10 3/4-ounce) can condensed nacho cheese soup, 4 skinned and boned chicken breast halves, cubed, Garnish: chopped fresh cilantro, 3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, 1 teaspoon minced garlic, 1 cup uncooked instant brown rice, 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1 medium onion, chopped, 1 (1.4-ounce) package fajita seasoning, divided, 1 (15 1/4-ounce) can whole kernel corn with red and green peppers, drained,
Diets supported: dairy free,
  • 1: Combine flour and 2 tablespoons fajita seasoning in a heavy-duty zip-top plastic bag; add chicken. Seal and shake to coat.
  • 2: Cook chicken in hot oil in a large Dutch oven over high heat, stirring often, 4 minutes or until browned. Reduce heat to medium-high; add onion and garlic; saut 5 minutes. Stir in remaining fajita seasoning, corn, next 5 ingredients, and, if desired, olives. Bring mixture to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer 5 minutes.
  • 3: Remove lid, and stir in nacho cheese soup, chopped cilantro, and lime juice.
  • 4: Garnish, if desired, and serve with breadsticks, if desired.
  • 1: Combine flour and 2 tablespoons fajita seasoning in a heavy-duty zip-top plastic bag; add chicken. Seal and shake to coat.

Stir in remaining fajita seasoning, corn, next 5 ingredients, and, if desired, olives. Bring mixture to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer 5 minutes.

NY Dog

Ingredients needed: 1 teaspoon ancho chili powder, 8 kosher beef hot dogs, Freshly ground black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon cayenne sauce, 1/2 cup Dijon mustard mixed with 2 tablespoons prepared horseradish, 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 8 good quality hot dog buns, split 3/4 through, 1/4 cup ketchup, 2 large onions, halved and cut 1/4-inch thick, 3 cloves roasted garlic, coarsely chopped, 3 roasted red peppers, julienned,
Diets supported: dairy free,
  • 1: Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
  • 2: Add onions and cook until soft. Stir in the cinnamon and chili powder and cook for 1 minute.
  • 3: Add the ketchup, water, hot sauce and salt and black pepper and bring to a simmer. Cook mixture for 10 to15 minutes or until thickened.
  • 4: Transfer to a bowl and let cool to room temperature before serving.

521240.modal:
×

Chicken, ham and potatoes pie

Ingredients needed: 1/4 c. of butter, 400-500 grams of skinless chicken thigh fillets, 1 cup of cream, 3/4 c. (or more) of full cream milk, 1 large onion, 1/4 c. of grated parmesan cheese, 3/4 kilo of potatoes or 2-1/4 c. of potato flakes, 1 small pack of mixed frozen vegetables (carrot, corn, peas), 200-300 grams of smoked ham,
Diets supported: gluten free, ketogenic,
  • 1: Prepare the mashed potatoes.If using fresh potatoes :Wash the potatoes and scrub well.
  • 2: Place in a large pan and cover with water. Set over high heat and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until tender. To test, pierce the thickest part with a sharp knife. If the knife goes all the way through without resistance, the potatoes are done.
  • 3: Drain the potatoes. As soon as they can be handled, peel off the skins and mash.
  • 4: Mix in the butter and season with salt and pepper.
  • 5: Pour in the milk slowly, stirring all the time to incorporate the milk into the mixture. Your mashed potato should not be too soft. When you reach the right consistency, stir in the parmesan.
  • 6: Add more salt and pepper, if necessary.If using potato flakes :Boil about 3 c. of water.
  • 7: Pour the hot water into a glass bowl and melt the butter in it.
  • 8: Add some salt and pepper.
  • 9: Pour in the potato flakes. Stir with a fork just until moistened.
  • 10: Let stand for 30 seconds to allow the flakes to rehydrate.
  • 11: Pour in the milk, stirring to incorporate. Stir in the parmesan. Adjust the seasonings, if necessary.(Note : Commercial potato flakes vary in their capacity to absorb liquid. Some do not expand well; others need plenty of water.)Set aside the mashed potatoes and allow to cool while you prepare the filling.
  • 12: Cut the chicken into 2-inch cubes. Season with salt and pepper.
  • 13: Cut the ham in roughly the same size. Roughly chop the onion.Melt the butter in a frying pan.
  • 14: Add the chicken and cook over medium-high heat until lightly browned.
  • 15: Add the smoked ham and chopped onion. Cook for a few minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onion bits start to turn brown.
  • 16: Add the mixed vegetables. Stir well.
  • 17: Pour in the cream and stir to blend.
  • 18: Add more salt and pepper if necessary. Lower the heat and cook until the liquid is bubbly.
  • 19: Transfer the chicken and vegetables to an 8-inch ovenproof dish.
  • 20: Spread the mashed potatoes on top. A little tip: If your dish is as full as mine (see the photo on the previous page), place a large piece of foil, cookie sheet or large baking tray under it before putting it in the oven. The sauce of the chicken mixture will boil and it will seep through the mashed potatoes along the edges of the oven dish. You don’t want the sauce dripping all over the oven floor. I spent 30 minutes cleaning up because I forgot about the aluminum foil.Grill or broil (top heat on) in a preheated 180oC oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until the top is lightly browned.When the top is lightly browned, turn off the heat and take the pie out of the oven. Cool for at least 10 to 15 minutes before serving. Otherwise, the mashed potatoes will still be too mushy and the sauce of the filling too runny.To serve, use a large spoon to dig into the pie so that one scoop will have mashed potatoes, chicken, ham and vegetables. The chicken, ham and potatoes pie goes very well with buttered and toasted French bread.

White Chili

Ingredients needed: 1 small bell pepper, chopped, 1 stalk celery, thinly sliced, 2 cups chicken broth, 2 Tablespoons cilantro, chopped, 1 -2 cups cooked rice, 1 cup of corn, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, 2 cloves of garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, juice and zest of 2 limes - 1/4 cup, 1 small onion, chopped, 1 teaspoon oregano, ½ pound pork roast or chicken, cooked and shredded, 3½ cups cooked white beans or 2 - 15 oz. cans of white beans, undrained,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free,
  • 1: In a large pot, brown onion, garlic, celery and bell pepper in the olive oil.In a small bowl, mix chicken broth and cornstarch, then add to the onions.Stir in all of the other ingredients.Cover; cook on low heat for 15 - 20 minutes.
  • 1: In a large pot, brown onion, garlic, celery and bell pepper in the olive oil.In a small bowl, mix chicken broth and cornstarch, then add to the onions.Stir in all of the other ingredients.Cover; cook on low heat for 15 - 20 minutes.

Brie Tart

Diets supported: lacto ovo vegetarian,
  • 1: Using a food processor, pulse the feta, ricotta, garlic, oil, lemon juice, herbs and crushed red pepper together until smooth.
  • 2: Drain and dice the roasted red pepper.Scoop the mixture into a bowl. Fold in the red pepper and ground black pepper. Refrigerate until ready to serve.To serve, drizzle another tablespoon of olive oil on top and serve with pita wedges and olives.

Brown Rice, Oat, and Nut Veggie Burger

Ingredients needed: ¼ cup uncooked sweet brown rice, 1 large egg, 2 teaspoons garlic powder, ½ teaspoon onion powder, 2 teaspoons oregano, ½ cup unroasted pecans, ½ cup rolled oats, ½ cup uncooked short-grain brown rice, ½ teaspoon smoked paprika, ½ unroasted sunflower seeds, ½ cup unroasted walnuts,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian,
  • 1: In a pot, combine the short-grain and the sweet brown rice. Cover with at least 3 cups water. Bring to a boil and cook until rice is just tender, 30-35 minutes.
  • 2: Remove from heat and drain well (press the rice down if need be to remove water.)In a large skillet, combine pecans, walnuts, and sunflower seeds. Stirring frequently, lightly toast the mix over low heat, 4-5 minutes. Nuts should be fragrant.
  • 3: Remove from heat and let cool slightly.In a food processor, pulse oats until resembling a coarse flour.
  • 4: Add in the nuts/seeds and continue to pulse until the mixture resembles a nut meal-like texture. Next, measure in the spices, cooked and drained brown rice, and egg. Continue to pulse until the mixture is well combined.Wet your hands and divide mixture into 8 pieces. Pat the pieces into patties, approximately ½" thick.
  • 5: Heat a skillet or grill pan over low heat. Cook patties on each side for 6-8 minutes. Burgers should be crisp on the outside and warm in the center.
  • 6: Serve with your favorite toppings.
    • Log in to view comments and ratings and save recipes

Miso Salmon

Ingredients needed: Marinade, 1 Tbsp. mirin, 1 Tbsp. sake, 14 oz (400 g) skin-on salmon fillet (cut in half if one big piece), 1 scallion for garnish (optional), 2 Tbsp. white miso*,
Diets supported: dairy free, pescatarian,
  • 1: Mix all the ingredients for the marinade in a large bowl.
  • 2: Place the salmon in the bowl, skin side up. Spoon marinade and coat the salmon skin. Cover and keep in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour. I dont recommend longer than that as miso is quite salty.Set the oven broiler to high and preheat for 3 minutes.
  • 3: Place the salmon fillets on the baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  • 4: Remove excess marinade from the salmon as miso gets burnt easily while cooking. Broil salmon for 10-12 minutes, depending on the thickness, until salmon is cooked through.Top broiled salmon with sesame seeds and thinly sliced scallion. I served the salmon on top of the Ginger Rice.
    • Log in to view comments and ratings and save recipes

619790.modal:

Easy rice, vegetables and sausage casserole

Ingredients needed: 1 cup grated cheddar cheese, 4 oz. cherry tomatoes, halved, 2-3 tablespoons grated parmesan, 12 oz. frozen vegetables, 10 oz. cooked sausage, sliced, 2 cups chicken or vegetable broth, 2 bags Success® White Rice, uncooked,
Diets supported: gluten free,
  • 1: Pre-heat the oven to 375F. In a 2qt casserole combine the rice and frozen vegetables. Season with salt and pepper.
  • 2: Pour the broth over them. Sprinkle the grated cheddar cheese over the rice mixture. Top the casserole with the sliced sausage, cherry tomatoes and grated parmesan.
  • 3: Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes until the rice is puffed.
  • 4: Serve warm.

B&b Muffins

Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup softened butter, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon baking soda, 1 egg, 1 large very ripe bananas, mashed, 3 tablespoons + 1 tsp natural plain yogurt, cup toasted walnuts, 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla, cup shredded coconut, 3/4 cup blueberries (divided),
Diets supported: lacto ovo vegetarian,
  • 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
  • 2: Line a muffin tin with 9 muffin cases.
  • 3: Cream together the butter and sugar with a mixer.
  • 4: Add the egg, mixing thoroughly, then stir in vanilla and blend well.
  • 5: In separate bowl whisk together flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda.
  • 6: Slowly add the dry ingredients into the butter mixture, alternating with the yogurt - make sure to start with flour and end with flour.
  • 7: Place the walnuts in a dry skillet over medium heat and cook for a 3-4 minutes, tossing frequently; Set aside and cool.
  • 8: Mash the bananas very well with a fork.
  • 9: Gently add the smashed bananas, toasted nuts and coconut into the batter then carefully stir until combined.
  • 10: Fold in blueberries, reserving a few for the top of each muffin.
  • 11: Pour the batter into the cases then sprinkle the remaining blueberries on top.
  • 12: Bake for 22-25 minutes or until tester comes out of the center of the muffin clean.
  • 13: Let cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring to a rack.
  • 14: Let cool for at least 5 minutes before serving.

Brie Tart

Ingredients needed: 1/2 pound ripe Brie cheese, 2 Egg, beaten, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric, pepper, 1 8" pie dough, unbaked, 2 tablespoons whipping cream,
Diets supported: lacto ovo vegetarian,
  • 1: Using a food processor, pulse the feta, ricotta, garlic, oil, lemon juice, herbs and crushed red pepper together until smooth.
  • 2: Drain and dice the roasted red pepper.Scoop the mixture into a bowl. Fold in the red pepper and ground black pepper. Refrigerate until ready to serve.To serve, drizzle another tablespoon of olive oil on top and serve with pita wedges and olives.
  • 1: Using a food processor, pulse the feta, ricotta, garlic, oil, lemon juice, herbs and crushed red pepper together until smooth.
  • 2: Drain and dice the roasted red pepper.Scoop the mixture into a bowl. Fold in the red pepper and ground black pepper. Refrigerate until ready to serve.To serve, drizzle another tablespoon of olive oil on top and serve with pita wedges and olives.
  • 1: Bake pie dough in a pre-heated 425 degree oven for 10 minutes.
  • 2: Remove all the rind from the Brie; cube.In a double boiler, slowly melt Brie.
  • 3: Add the rest of the ingredients, stirring frequently.
  • 4: Pour the cheese mixture into the pie shell and bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes, or until lightly browned.
  • 1: Bake pie dough in a pre-heated 425 degree oven for 10 minutes.
  • 2: Remove all the rind from the Brie; cube.In a double boiler, slowly melt Brie.
  • 3: Add the rest of the ingredients, stirring frequently.

Rice, Cheddar & Spinach Pie

Ingredients needed: 1 cup diced extra-sharp Cheddar cheese, 3 cups cooked instant or quick-cooking brown rice, 4 large eggs, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup nonfat milk, 1 small onion, finely chopped, 1 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry,
Diets supported: gluten free, lacto ovo vegetarian,
  • 1: Preheat oven to 425F. Generously coat a 9-inch pie pan with cooking spray.
  • 2: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
  • 3: Add onion and cook, stirring frequently, until beginning to brown, about 5 minutes.
  • 4: Add garlic and spinach; cook, stirring, 1 minute more.
  • 5: Transfer to a large bowl.
  • 6: Add rice, cheese, pepper and salt to the bowl and stir to combine.
  • 7: Whisk eggs and milk in a medium bowl. Stir into the spinach-rice mixture.
  • 8: Transfer to the prepared pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
  • 9: Bake the pie until lightly browned in spots, about 25 minutes.
  • 10: Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting into wedges.

Zucchini Muffins

Ingredients needed: 2 large eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 3 cups (packed) grated fresh zucchini, 3/4 cup unsalted butter, melted, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 2 teaspoons cinnamon, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, 1 cup walnuts (optional), 1 cup raisins or dried cranberries (optional),
Diets supported: lacto ovo vegetarian,
  • 1: You don't need a mixer for this recipe.
  • 2: Mix eggs, sugar, vanilla, then add zucchini and melted butter: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Beat the eggs in a large bowl.
  • 3: Mix in the  sugar and vanilla extract. Stir in the grated zucchini and the melted butter.
  • 4: Mix dry ingredients: In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, ground ginger, nutmeg, and salt.
  • 5: Combine to make batter: Stir these dry ingredients into the zucchini mixture. (Do not over-mix!) Stir in walnuts, raisins or cranberries if using.
  • 6: Fill muffin pan: Coat each muffin cup in your muffin pan with a little butter or vegetable oil spray. Use a spoon to distribute the muffin dough equally among the cups, filling the cups up completely, above the surface of the muffin tin.

Pumpkin Muffins

Ingredients needed: 1 teaspoon Baking Powder, ½ teaspoon Baking Soda, 1 teaspoon Cinnamon, 1 teaspoon Pumpkin Pie Spice, 1 cup canned pumpkin - not pumpkin pie mix, 2 large eggs, room temperature, 1/4 cup Pecans or Walnuts, chopped finely, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 3 tablespoons butter, softened,
Diets supported:
  • 1: Set the oven rack to the center position. Preheat to 350F (117C).
  • 2: Lightly grease a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray or vegetable oil, or add paper liners.
  • 3: In a large bowl, sift the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, and allspice together. Thoroughly mix with a whisk until combined.
  • 4: In a medium bowl whisk together eggs, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until smooth and pale yellow in color, 1 minute.
  • 5: Slowly whisk in the vegetable oil into the egg mixture until completely mixed, about 30 seconds.
  • 6: Whisk in pumpkin, whole milk, sour cream, and vanilla extract into the egg mixture until smooth, about 30 seconds.
  • 7: Add the egg mixture to the flour mixture. Gently fold the flour mixture until just moistened, making sure to scrape the bottom with some lumps and flour spots remaining. Do not over mix the batter.
  • 8: Evenly divide the muffin batter amongst the cups, about cup per muffin.
  • 9: Sprinkle some granulated sugar and cinnamon on top of each muffin.
  • 10: Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean or internal temperature reaches 205 to 210F (96 to 99C) with a thermometer, about 20 to 24 minutes.
  • 11: Cool the pumpkin muffins in a pan for 5 minutes.
  • 12: Carefully run a knife or spatula along the sides of each muffin tin to remove.
  • 13: Transfer to a wire rack to cool down.
  • 1: Note: click on times in the instructions to start a kitchen timer while cooking.
  • 2: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
  • 3: Line the muffin tin with muffin liners.
  • 4: In a large bowl add the pumpkin puree, eggs, oil, water and sugar and whisk until fully combined.
  • 5: Add in the flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves and ginger to the bowl and whisk until just combined.
  • 6: Using a 1/4 cup ice cream scoop, scoop the batter into each liner.
  • 7: Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
  • 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees and place cupcake liners in a muffin tin
  • 2: Combine dry ingredients; flour, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon. Set aside.
  • 3: Combine in a large bowl the wet ingredients; pumpkin, sugar, oil, and eggs.
  • 4: Whisk to combine
  • 5: Divide batter into liners using a cookie dough scoop, add about 2 tablespoons for mini muffins and 1/3 cup for a standard size. If using crumb topping, evenly sprinkle it over the top of the muffins.
  • 6: Bake at 350 degrees - minis for about 10-12 minutes and standard size for 15-22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
  • 7: Cool completely. Store in an airtight container.
